Discovery of hazardous materials or human remains that could put the team at risk and require immediate evacuation.
Lack of funding or resources to support the dig, such as equipment, transportation, or food supplies.
Miscommunication or misunderstandings between team members, leading to confusion or conflict.
Technical difficulties or malfunctions of equipment, such as a breakdown of the excavator or GPS device.
Unexpected cultural or historical significance of the site that could require additional permits or restrictions.
